quest.name: My First Daggers
journal: Lonwoerd would have you reaffirm your desire to join the Rogues' Guild.
Lonwoerd suggests that you meet with the master of the Rogues' Guild. Head inside and speak with Jacke.

After listening to Jacke's explanation of “the job,” you convince the guildmaster that you're willing to embrace the shadowy life of a rogue. Equip the weathered daggers, and speak with Jacke once more.

dialogue.name: LONWOERD
dialogue.text: I didn't scare you off, then? Bene. They told me ye was a mettlesome lasscove, an' so it's proved.

dialogue.name: LONWOERD
dialogue.text: Ye'll need every onze o' that mettle soon enough. Now step inside an' have a prattle with Jacke. He's our Upright Man─the master o' the guild.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You may now freely enter the Rogues' Guild. Speak with Lonwoerd whenever you wish to gain admittance to the guild's headquarters.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Aye, I'm the one they call “Jacke”─though I'm surprised ye've heard o' me. Perhaps ye'd be good enough to tell me yer name...along with that o' the kindly cove as told ye mine?

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Ahhh! The famous Forename! Ol' Lonny Left-patch let you in, did he?

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Hmmm... He can't throw a blade for shite, but that one eye don't miss naught when it comes to sizin' up a dimber mortcolt for the stallin'.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Just one thing... You ain't a pirate, are ye?

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Well, then, it's time ye was stalled to the rogue! Pull on yer best beater cases an' I'll swear ye in meself when yer ready.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Now, I could fill yer wattles with the storied history of our guild, but that's just whids an' wind. The most important thing─the only thing─we care about is gettin' the job done.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Now, most folk, an' I'm assumin' yer among 'em, know that not long after Limsa's foundin', the city was overrun by a motley collection o' pirates an' thieves.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: But as wild as that lot were, it soon became clear that they'd all end up killin' each other if they didn't lay down a few rules─an unspoken code o' conduct, as it were.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: One, ye don't bite the purses o' yer fellow Lominsans; two, ye don't rook a crew out o' their spoils; an' three, ye don't trade culls like they was chattel. I'll admit the finer points o' the code are a mite murky, but most agree on those three, at least.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Now, ye might be thinkin' none o' that amounts to a sack o' dilberries now the Admiral's outlawed piracy, but in the back alleys an' black markets where Merlwyb's grip ain't so tight, the code's still alive an' well.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: An' just as the law is enforced by the Yellowjackets, the code is regulated by us rogues.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: We go where the shadows are darkest, an' hand out justice to them as break the code. Some rum-soaked cove steals goods from the wrong cull, an' we steal 'em back. That's the job, my natty lasslad.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: 'Course, we don't hop the twig when bladework's called for, neither.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Ye'll see there's more to our daggerplay than just stickin' culls with the pointy end. We'll weaken a mark with poison, fade away an' strike in the darkmans─whatever it takes to get the work done.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Well, Forename? What do ye say to that? Got the guts to do a rogue's job?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Do you have the guts to do a rogue's job?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: All right, then! First off, we'll have to get yer kit sorted out.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: A rogue needs to be light on herhis dew beaters to stay on a mark's trail. The job might have ye fightin' across a deck or weavin' through a mob, an' the last thing ye want is a bleedin' great battleaxe what hooks itself on every rope an' post.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: That's why we stick to daggers─they let ye slip through the streets just as easily as they slip through a rook's ribs.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Here, take these stabbers an' let's see how they look on ye. ...Just don't get so excited with yer new toys that ye forget to dress for the role. Ye'd be surprised at how many colts come back to me in their bloody smallclothes...

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: A pity, but it's your choice to make, lasslad. The life of a rogue ain't for the pigeon-livered.

dialogue.name: LONWOERD
dialogue.text: Ye lookin' to head inside?

dialogue.name: Q9
dialogue.text: Enter the Rogues' Guild?

dialogue.name: A9
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A9
dialogue.text: No

obj.n: So You Want to Be a Rogue
